# Pull Request

## Description

Brief description of what this PR does.

Fixes #(issue_number)

## Type of Change

Please check the relevant option(s):

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Code refactoring (no functional changes)
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Test updates
- [ ] Build/CI changes

## Changes Made

Provide a detailed list of changes:

- Change 1
- Change 2
- Change 3

## Testing

Describe the tests you ran to verify your changes:

- [ ] Unit tests added/updated
- [ ] Integration tests added/updated
- [ ] E2E tests added/updated
- [ ] Manual testing performed

**Test configuration**:
- OS:
- Python version:
- PyTorch version:

**Test details**:
```bash
# Commands run for testing
pytest tests/test_my_feature.py
```

## Screenshots (if applicable)

Add screenshots or output logs demonstrating the changes.

## Checklist

Please check all that apply:

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines (Black, isort, type hints)
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published
- [ ] I have updated the CHANGELOG.md (if applicable)

## Documentation

- [ ] Documentation has been updated (docs/)
- [ ] Examples have been added/updated (examples/)
- [ ] Docstrings added/updated for new functions/classes
- [ ] README updated (if needed)
- [ ] No documentation changes needed

## Breaking Changes

If this PR introduces breaking changes, please describe:

- What breaks
- Why it was necessary
- How users should migrate

## Performance Impact

- [ ] This change improves performance
- [ ] This change has no significant performance impact
- [ ] This change may impact performance (please describe)

**Performance details** (if applicable):
```
# Benchmarks or profiling results
Before: X seconds
After: Y seconds
```

Any additional information that reviewers should know:

## Reviewer Checklist

(For maintainers)

- [ ] Code quality is acceptable
- [ ] Tests are comprehensive
- [ ] Documentation is clear and complete
- [ ] No obvious security issues
- [ ] Performance impact is acceptable
- [ ] Breaking changes are justified and documented
- [ ] Commit messages follow conventional commits format
